Description: Body sherd of Attic red-figured pottery bell- or calyx-krater; interior glazed black; exterior: red-figure decoration consisting of female figure to right (only bottom of garments and foot remaining); some background decoration in added white; below, maeander frieze.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0224) (Phase 1)
